slide.title: Resources
slide.p: RH Academy portal ... see D2L for the link to signup. This gives you access to HTML student guides for any courses you "buy". This is an off-campus resource, and the BCIT privacy policies apply. A written consent will be required of all students who wish to proceed!
RH Classroom server ... Red Hat has a classroom server, mentioned in and assumed by the student guide. We are not using that, and will have to make allowances.
You will setup CentOS on your own systems ... one instance to start with, using a VirtualBox VM. Later on, we will use VMware and also the Pi.

slide.title: Deviating from Normal ...
slide.p: A few things are different in this course, compared to CST, but you are already familiar with them :)

ul.li: Flipped Learning - weekly readings/watchings will be assigned, some with a D2L survey to complete by the evening before that week's seminar.
Flipped LMS - our course hub has deep links into D2L, rather than the other way around.
"Authentic" assessment - hands-on labs, with proof of successful completion; hands-on midterm and maybe hands-on final!
Organizer, and *our* lessons, tutorials, and lab/assignment writeups all on our course hub.
Any Red Hat proprietary material will be on D2L.
Labs/walkthroughs done individually, although some may be in pairs or teams.
Assignments done in pairs, and they may tie-in with ACIT2515.
